item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Suggests New Sprinkler Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley fans were disappointed to discover that sprinklers cannot fill pet bowls on the farm.
  • While there is no negative outcome for not filling pet bowls, players hope for an option to use sprinklers in the future.

A Stardew Valley fan has pointed out that sprinklers lack the ability to fill pet bowls. The discovery disappoitned the player, and many have agreed that it's something that they'd like to see added to Stardew Valley .

When a new player starts Stardew Valley , they're asked if they prefer dogs or cats. In the early days of the game, the player will eventually meet Marnie on their doorstep, who offers them the chance to adopt whichever type of pet they selected on that screen. If a player does adopt a cat or dog, they can interact with the animal, give them water, and gain affection, similar to other animals on the farm. However, one fan was surprised to discover that what seemed like a great idea didn't work at all.

Related
Stardew Valley: How to Get and Use Magic Hair Gel

Elevate your character's appearance with the Magic Hair Gel in Stardew Valley. Learn how to obtain this item in this guide.

Stardew Valley player Genoooos shared their discovery that sprinklers can't fill pet bowls. Sprinklers are generally used on farm plots to keep crops healthy without having to water them manually, saving the player time and energy. However, they can also be used for things like filling water troughs for slimes, so it struck some fans as odd that the same doesn't work for pet bowls. Genoooos had cleverly set up a sprinkler to sit in the middle of multiple pet bowls, hoping it would fill them, to no avail.

The Potential Pros and Cons of Automatically Filling Pet Bowls

Fans in the comments were quick to point out that watering one's pet helps to increase affection, which can take a long time to build with a pet due to the limited interactions that count per day. With that in mind, it seems logical that a method of automatically filling a water bowl wouldn't have the same impact on the pet. While this could be a problem for some players, the Stardew Valley 1.6 update added the option to adopt multiple pets after the player's original pet reaches max affection. It seems reasonable, then, for the sprinklers to at least work on the additional pets' bowls, or all of them, considering the first pet's relationship will be maxed out by that point.

This lack of interaction with Stardew Valley 's pet bowls may have been intentional on the developer's part, though some players pointed out that there is a potential middle ground. When it rains, the pet's bowl is automatically filled for the day. In theory, sprinklers could fill water bowls the same way, without adding any affection points to the relationship.

Adding water to a pet's bowl in Stardew Valley is completely optional, and there's no negative outcome for not doing so. With the ability to now adopt a ton of pets in Stardew Valley , though, it might be useful to have an automatic option to fill all the bowls at once with a sprinkler, if only for the visual appeal. Time will tell if developer ConcernedApe tweaks this or adds a new option for automatic bowl filling.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Players Have the Chance to Get Azure Hanzo Skin
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players can obtain the Legendary Azure Flame Hanzo skin for Overwatch 2 before the Champions Series event.
  • The new Azure Flame Hanzo Crowdfunding Bundle is available with various accessories.
  • Blizzard supports Overwatch 2 with seasonal content, updates, and new cosmetics.

For a limited time, Overwatch 2 players will be able to obtain the Legendary Azure Flame Hanzo skin and other accessories based on the popular hero. The new Overwatch 2 skin will be available leading up to the first in-person Overwatch Champions Series event near the end of the month.

Despite the controversies that came with Overwatch 2's launch, the game became highly successful and drew in millions of players around the world. Like the original Overwatch game, Blizzard supports Overwatch 2 with a steady stream of seasonal content, updates, and new cosmetics. These cosmetics, including skins, allow players to customize their favorite heroes and add a personal touch before heading into battle. Overwatch 2's Mythic skins are some of the most coveted, so players were frustrated when Blizzard temporarily disabled these cosmetics due to strange bugs that were affecting online play. Mythic skins are available again in Overwatch 2 , and players should be able to acquire the new Azure Flame Hanzo skin without any issues either.

Related
Hilarious Overwatch 2 Clip Shows Two Ana Players Perfectly Mirroring Each Other In a 1v1

A pair of Ana players in Overwatch 2 get into the spirit of Mirrorwatch by perfectly copying one another's plays during a hilarious 1v1 skirmish.

Blizzard confirmed that the new paid Azure Flame Hanzo skin is now available from May 21 to June 3 in Overwatch 2 . The skin is available in the Azure Flame Hanzo Crowdfunding Bundle with 25% of the revenue generated from sales going into the prize pool for the Overwatch Champions Series DreamHack Dallas Major event, which takes place from May 31 to June 2. Like past Overwatch 2 bundles , the new Azure Flame Hanzo bundle includes additional accessories, including the Azure Moon name card, Azure Flame player icon, Azure Guardian spray, and Dragon Guardian weapon charm.

Blizzard Reveals Azure Flame Hanzo Crowdfunding Bundle

  • Available from May 21 to June 3
  • Includes:
    • Legendary Azure Flame Hanzo skin
    • Azure Moon Name Card
    • Azure Flame Player Icon
    • Azure Guardian Spray
    • Dragon Guardian Weapon Charm

According to Blizzard, the new Azure Flame Hero skin is meant to "evoke the unstoppable power of our top-tier competitors." Skin designer TB Choi focused on making players feel "powerful" with the skin equipped in Overwatch 2 , and natural lightning, thunder, storm, and flame motifs were the main inspirations for the new skin. The skin may aesthetically empower players in Overwatch 2 competitive modes , but players playing more casually may still enjoy the new skin.

Overwatch 2 players interested in the upcoming Overwatch Champions Series Esports event can also earn various rewards by tuning in on Twitch and YouTube. Twitch and YouTube users watching the event may earn free in-game rewards such as the Dallas Major - Day player icon, Rodeo Ashe spray, Porsche Drift spray, and OWCS Home weapon charm by having up to 12 hours of watch time. These rewards may also be earned by watching featured co-streamers, similar to Overwatch 2's recent Twitch Drops campaign .

item.title: World of Warcraft: The War Within Finally Adding Missing Transmog Option After Five Years
item.description:
Highlights

  • Finally, WoW players can hide pants with new transmog system in The War Within after 5 years.
  • This option allows for more outfit customization and avoids clipping issues with robes.
  • Fans are excited for the control over character appearance, especially with unique race customization.

World of Warcraft players will finally be able to hide their pants via the transmog system in The War Within . This transmog option has been five years in the making, and will let World of Warcraft characters more easily wear certain outfits or show off their unique character customizations.

In Vanilla, World of Warcraft players only had the option to hide their helmet and cloak via an interface toggle, a function the transmog system took over when the feature was introduced in WoW: Cataclysm . Then, during Battle for Azeroth in 2019, World of Warcraft added new transmog options that allowed fans to hide the appearance of every armor slot except pants.

Related
World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria Makes It Easier to Get a Shirt and Tabard

World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria players looking to make the perfect transmog can now pick up a shirt and tabard without any trouble.

However, The War Within is bringing the hidden transmog system full circle. As of a recent build of the WoW: The War Within alpha , World of Warcraft characters have the option to hide their pants slot while making a transmog. Five years after the rest of the hidden transmogs options were added, players can finally hide any type of gear they want for maximum character customization.

Hide Pants Transmog Option in WoW: The War Within

This option is important because of the control it puts in the hands of fans. There are tons of dresses in the game, such as the Lovely Black Dress from Love is In The Air or the Gossamer Desert Gown from the World of Warcraft Trading Post catalogue in January , that feature leg slits where pants are visible. The ability to hide pants will open up tons of transmog options with these outfits, and will avoid clipping issues with some robes. Additionally, new races like the Dracthyr and Earthen have unique customization options for their legs, so the ability to hide pants will let players show off these special characteristics more readily.

Needless to say, fans are excited that World of Warcraft is finally adding this option. Tons of NPCs in World of Warcraft utilize transmogs with hidden pants already, including popular characters like Valeera Sanguinar, the Blood Elf rogue, and Sally Whitemane – the iconic final boss of the Scarlet Monastary dungeon in WoW . With this option at their disposal, players will no longer have to hunt around for substitutes while trying to make transmogs inspired by these looks.

The War Within itself is going to be huge for transmog lovers. World of Warcraft is letting players of any class unlock item appearances they come across, regardless of weapon and armor proficiencies. Fans who have looted rare World of Warcraft items like the Tusks of Mannoroth or the Warglaives of Azzinoth on characters who cannot use the items will soon be able to unlock the appearances for their accounts, so players should be sure to hold on to any such gear they find until the Warbands system goes live later this year.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Makes Adorable Shellder Plush
item.description:
Highlights

  • Shellder remains unchanged but is central to evolutions of popular Slowbro and Slowking in the Pokemon universe.
  • A talented fan created a high-quality 12-inch Shellder plush toy, complete with accurate details and soft materials.
  • Despite its lack of new evolutions, Shellder has appeared in every mainline Pokemon game, hinting at possible future variations.

A talented Pokemon fan has shared their adorable plush creation of a Shellder. The common Kanto-region Pokemon has a fair share of fans who would likely be charmed by this Pokemon plush toy.

Shellder got its introduction back in Pokemon Red and Blue with the other 150 first-gen Pokemon . While it's a Pokemon all on its own, it also has the unusual quality of potentially merging with a second Pokemon, Slowpoke. Shellder hasn't seen many changes in recent years, but Slowpoke's Shellder-dependent evolutions have gained new forms. Pokemon like Galarian Slowbro, Mega Slowbro, and Slowking all change the way that the Shellder is attached to the Pokemon and how it looks, adding some variety to the Pokemon that it's otherwise lacking in its own evolutionary line.

Related
Pokemon Fan Artist Makes Detailed Regional Flags From Each Generation

A Pokemon fan creates flags for each region of the main series and shares details about the inspirations behind each design.

Although Slowbro and Slowking's Shellders are certainly interesting, this particular Pokemon fan's creation focuses on the original form of Shellder when it's still an individual. The purple shell Pokemon has been reproduced by AnnushkaToys in excellent detail, measuring about 12 inches. The Bivalve Pokemon plush is made out of minky microfiber fabric and is stuffed with hollow fibre stuffing to give it a soft and squishy quality. The overall design of the Pokemon has been recreated extremely well, down to the funny tongue rolling out of the Shellder's face and the bugged-out eyes peeking out of the shell.

This particular fan is no stranger to creating charming plush toys based off video games. A look at their profile shows that they've also made numerous plush toys based off of another Nintendo smash hit , namely Animal Crossing . While some game fans enjoy making things like this solely as gifts or to keep, this particular fan does sell their plush creations in an online shop, for any fans who might be interested in making this Shellder toy their own.

Shellder is Unique, but a Common Sight

Shellder hasn't received a new evolution of its own since its release. Its standard evolution, Cloyster, is probably better known as being a part of Slowbro and Slowking at this point than being its own Pokemon. However, it's also been extremely prevalent, unlike some other Kanto-region Pokemon . Shellder has been in every mainline Pokemon game with the exception of Pokemon Legends: Arceus . It remains to be seen if it's also absent in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , or if it will follow the typical trend instead. It also remains to be seen if Shellder will ever receive an alternate form or evolution. While it's an older Pokemon, Game Freak has looked to the Kanto region many times while creating regional forms and other unique takes, so nothing's out of the question.

item.title: Epic Games Store Teases May 23 Free Mystery Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Epic Games teases Farming Simulator 22 as next mystery game, fans connect the dots quickly.
  • Dragon Age: Inquisition was the most recent mystery game, now it's time for Farming Simulator 22.
  • Mixed reception for the Farming Simulator 22 announcement, fans still excited for upcoming AAA games.

Epic Games has teased its next mystery game which is slated to be available on May 23, and it seems like it might be Farming Simulator 22 after all. While the Epic Games Store mystery game tease might look quite cryptic at first, fans were quick to connect the dots and associate it with the cover art of Farming Simulator 22.

Epic Games Store's mystery game promotion has been running for a long time now, and fans have received a number of exciting games over the years. The most recent one has been Dragon Age: Inquisition, which is one of the most critically acclaimed RPGs of all time. Fans are always speculating what game Epic Games could give away next, and they have time and again surprised the community. However, the next one seems to be not that tough to figure out.

Related
Fortnite Maker Epic Games Hit With $1 Million Fine

Fortnite developer Epic Games faces major legal fines, prompting larger discussions about a controversial topic in the video game industry.

In a new tweet, Epic Games dropped a teaser for its next mystery game. There is a circular display in the center of the video that portrays a glitched animation. It is quite easy to see that the glitched animation contains a vehicle of some sort, but upon closer inspection, it is in fact a tractor. And that is not just a random tractor, but the one that is featured in the cover image of Farming Simulator 22 . It was previously leaked that the mystery game for May 23 might be Farming Simulator 22 , so it isn't all surprising to see this.

Epic Games Store Free Mystery Games May 2024

  • Dragon Age: Inquisition (May 16 - May 23)
  • RUMOR: Farming Simulator 22 (May 23 - May 30)
  • ??? (May 30 - June 6)
  • ??? (June 6 - June 13)
